intro: Adonis annua subsp. autumnalis, commonly known as autumn adonis, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a biennial or short-lived perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant produces striking yellow flowers with prominent yellow anthers that release pollen in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and alternate, with a slightly hairy surface. The plant is often found in grasslands, wastelands, and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
